wesm commented on issue #4825: ARROW-5878: [C++] Coerce strictly to TIMESTAMP_MICROS/TIMESTAMP_MILLIS
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4825#issuecomment-509388706
 
 
   Hmm. So the key changes needed are
   
   * set TIMESTAMP_MICROS/MILLIS unconditional on whether `isAdjustedToUTC` is set. 
   * Having this converted type should yield a time zone naive timestamp unless the LogicalType is set. 
   
   This change appears to do more than this. I don't think that TIMESTAMP_MICROS ConvertedType being set should imply `arrow::timestamp(TimeUnit::MICROS, "UTC")`
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

tpboudreau commented on issue #4825: ARROW-5878: [C++] Coerce strictly to TIMESTAMP_MICROS/TIMESTAMP_MILLIS
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4825#issuecomment-509457910
 
 
   I understand your motivations, but writing converted type TIMESTAMP_* next to LogicalType(isAdjusted=false) for the same field is inconsistent with the parquet.thrift spec and could confuse a reasonable interpreter (e.g. another library writer).  I believe the spec writers erred in (apparently) layering the semantic nuance about UTC adjustment onto the pre-existing TIMESTAMP_* types after-the-fact.  Whether or not this change proceeds, it might be a good idea to amend the parquet.thrift spec to the effect that TIMESTAMP converted types are UTC-adjustment agnostic, i.e., they apply to both adjusted and non-adjusted LogicalType timestamps.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Timestamps without timezone which are written by pyarrow 0.14.0 cannot be read anymore as timestamps by earlier versions. The timestamp is read as an integer when reading in with pyarrow 0.13.0

Looking at the parquet schemas, it seems that the logical type cannot be understood by the older versions, see below.
h4. File generation with pyarrow 0.14.0
{code:java}
import datetime
import pyarrow.parquet as pq
import pandas as pd

df = pd.DataFrame(
    {
        "datetime64": pd.Series(["2018-01-01"], dtype="datetime64[ns]"),
        "datetime64_ts": pd.Series(
            [pd.Timestamp(datetime.datetime(2018, 1, 1), tz="Europe/Berlin")],
            dtype="datetime64[ns]",
        ),
    }
)
pq.write_table(pa.Table.from_pandas(df), "timezones_pyarrow_14.paquet")
{code}
h4. Reading with pyarrow 0.13.0
{code:java}
In [1]: import pyarrow.parquet as pq

In [2]: import pyarrow as pa

In [3]: with open("timezones_pyarrow_14.paquet", "rb") as fd:
   ...:     table = pq.read_pandas(fd)
   ...:

In [4]: table.to_pandas()
Out[4]:
         datetime64             datetime64_ts
0  1514764800000000 2018-01-01 00:00:00+01:00

In [5]: table.to_pandas().dtypes
Out[5]:
datetime64                               int64
datetime64_ts    datetime64[ns, Europe/Berlin]
dtype: object
{code}
h3. Parquet schema as seen by pyarrow versions:

pyarrow 0.13.0 parquet schema
{code:java}
datetime64: INT64
datetime64_ts: INT64 TIMESTAMP_MICROS
{code}
pyarrow 0.14.0 parquet schema
{code:java}
datetime64: INT64 Timestamp(isAdjustedToUTC=false, timeUnit=microseconds)
datetime64_ts: INT64 Timestamp(isAdjustedToUTC=true, timeUnit=microseconds)
{code}
fields.summary: [Python][C++] Parquet reader not forward compatible for timestamps without timezone

comments.body:
This is sort of a grey area because of comments in parquet.thrift

https://github.com/apache/parquet-format/blob/master/src/main/thrift/parquet.thrift#L334

I am OK with always setting TIMESTAMP_MICROS/TIMESTAMP_MILLIS ConvertedType for data that originates from Arrow.

Do you want to submit a PR? We are probably doing a 0.14.1 release so this can get fixed fairly soon
